p: Several studies followed the levels of organic acids and titratable acidity in aril juice during fruit development. Indian and Tunisian cultivars grown in India (“Ganesh” and “Taifi”) (Kulkarni and Aradhya, 2005), and Israeli and American cultivars grown in Israel (“Rosh Hapered” and “Wonderful”) (Shwartz et al., 2009) showed that total acidity decreased during fruit maturation. Respectively, the TSS to total acidity ratio and the pH increased across all the tested cultivars.
